clap.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to hit your hands against each other many times to make a sound that shows your approval, agreement, or enjoyment
clap.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: One man began to clap, and others joined in.
The couple were cheered and clapped on their arrival.
The audience clapped politely but without much enthusiasm.
clap.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: if you clap your hands, you hit your hands together a few times to attract someone’s attention or to show that you are pleased
clap.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Narouz clapped his hands and a servant entered.
Mandy laughed and clapped her hands in delight.
clap.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to put your hand on something quickly and firmly
clap.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: ‘Mick!’ She clapped her hand over her mouth. ‘I’d forgotten!’
Ben grinned and clapped me amiably on the shoulder.
clap.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: the loud sound that you make when you hit your hands together many times to show that you enjoyed something
clap.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Come on everyone, let’s give Tommy a clap.
